intro: Cephalostigma candolleanum, commonly known as the white-flowered cephalostigma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
